thread.title: MT could face tough bargaining with federal officials on Medicaid expansion plan
thread.title_full: MT could face tough bargaining with federal officials on Medicaid expansion plan

title: MT could face tough bargaining with federal officials on Medicaid expansion plan
text:
RSS Kaiser Health News / Montana Public Radio , July 10, 2015 
Montana's blueprint for expanding Medicaid on terms that are palatable to the fragile bipartisan legislative majority that passed an expansion law earlier this year has been released for public comment before it is formally submitted to federal officials. A leading expert on Medicaid waivers, however, says Montana is unlikely to get exactly what it wants. "A waiver proposal never comes out the way that it went in," said Joan Alker, executive director of the Center for Children and Families at Georgetown University. "All of these waiver negotiations require some flexibility on both sides."
